original_solution_mapping.L1: He drinks 504 ounces of water per week because 72 x 7 = <<72*7=504>>504
original_solution_mapping.L2: He will need to fill it 6 times because 504 / 84 = <<504/84=6>>6

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4875.
    Returns: the number of times Tony will fill his water bottle each week.
    """
    # L1
    water_per_day = 72 # 72 ounces of water per day
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    water_per_week = water_per_day * days_per_week

    # L2
    bottle_capacity = 84 # an 84-ounce water bottle
    fills_per_week = water_per_week / bottle_capacity

    # FA
    answer = fills_per_week
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He drinks {water_per_week} ounces of water per week because {water_per_day} x {days_per_week} = <<{water_per_day}*{days_per_week}={water_per_week}>>{water_per_week}
He will need to fill it {fills_per_week} times because {water_per_week} / {bottle_capacity} = <<{water_per_week}/{bottle_capacity}={fills_per_week}>>{fills_per_week}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He drinks 504 ounces of water per week because 72 x 7 = <<72*7=504>>504
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He will need to fill it 1 times because 84 / 84 = <<84/84=1>>1

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'bottle_capacity' (value: 84) was used instead of 'water_per_week' (value: 504).
